Package at.jku.swe.simcomp.azureadapter.service.Services

Class AzureSimulationInstanceService

java.lang.Object
at.jku.swe.simcomp.azureadapter.service.Services.AzureSimulationInstanceService
All Implemented Interfaces:
at.jku.swe.simcomp.commons.adaptor.endpoint.simulation.SimulationInstanceService
@Service public class AzureSimulationInstanceService extends Object implements at.jku.swe.simcomp.commons.adaptor.endpoint.simulation.SimulationInstanceService
The AzureSimulationInstanceService class is an implementation of the SimulationInstanceService interface, providing functionalities to manage simulation instances in an Azure environment.

This service is responsible for adding, removing, and retrieving simulation instances, as well as handling cleanup operations during the destruction of the service bean.

The service uses Azure-specific functionality provided by the AzureService class for creating and deleting digital twins associated with simulation instances.

Instances of this service can be configured with a specific adaptor name, and it ensures that simulation instances added to the service match the configured adaptor name.

This service also supports the registration of removal listeners to receive notifications when simulation instances are removed.

Instances and removal listeners are maintained in thread-safe data structures to handle concurrent access.

The service utilizes the SLF4J logging framework for logging information and errors.

Note: This class uses Lombok annotations, such as @Slf4j, for logging.
